newsitem.title: USA: Promus Remington to develop 10 hotels.
newsitem.headline: Promus Remington to develop 10 hotels.

text.p: Promus Hotel Corp said Thursday it made an agreement with Remington Hotel Corp of Dallas and Nomura Asset Capital Corp to develop 10 franchised Embassy Suites hotels in major markets across the United States.
Plans call for groundbreaking on the first two hotels in Dallas and Austin within 60 days, with all 10 to be under construction within 18 months.

Among the market areas targeted for development are: the Texas Galleria in Dallas, the Texas Arboretum in Austin; Dulles Airport in the greater Washington D.C. area; Princeton, New Jersey; and the Boston suburbs. Other sites are under consideration as well.

Nomura Asset Capital will provide construction financing that will convert to permament financing once hotel operations have stablized. Promus Hotels will provide mezzanine financing as part of the overall agreement, with the remaining equity provided by a joint venture comprised of the Bennett family, owners of Remington Hotel, and Nomura.
Of the 20 Embassy Suites hotels in development, seven will be in Latin America. At year's end, Promus had 136 Embassy Suites hotels open, with almost 33,000 suites available to serve guests.
